ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies the input SAS data set.

Syntax: FORMCHAR <(position(s))>='formatting-character(s)'
      
Defines the characters to use for constructing the borders of the plot.

[Syntax: HPERCENT=percent(s)] 
      
Specifies one or more percentages of the available horizontal space to use for each plot.

Includes missing character variable values in the construction of the axes. It has 
no effect on numeric variables.

Suppresses the legend at the top of each plot. The legend lists the names
of the variables being plotted and the plotting symbols used in the plot.
Excludes observations for which either variable is missing from the calculation of the axes.

Uniformly scales axes across BY groups. Uniform scaling enables you to directly compare 
the plots for different values of the BY variables.

Restriction: You cannot use PROC PLOT with the UNIFORM option with an engine that 
supports concurrent access if another user is updating the data set at the same time.

[Syntax: VPERCENT=percent(s)] 
      
Specifies one or more percentages of the available vertical space to use for each plot. 
If you use a percentage greater than 100, then PROC PLOT prints sections of the plot on 
successive pages.

[Syntax: VTOH=aspect-ratio] 
      
Specifies the aspect ratio (vertical to horizontal) of the characters on the 
output device. aspect-ratio is a positive real number.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BY <DESCENDING> variable-1 <...<DESCENDING> variable-n> <NOTSORTED>;
      
Produces a separate plot and starts a new page for each BY group.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that 
immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.
Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PLOT plot-request(s) </ option(s)>;
          
Requests the plots to be produced by PROC PLOT. You can use multiple PLOT statements.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Draws a border around the entire plot, rather than just on the left side and bottom.

Syntax: CONTOUR<=number-of-levels>
          
Draws a contour plot using plotting symbols with varying degrees of shading where 
number-of-levels is the number of levels for dividing the range of variable.

[Syntax: HAXIS=axis-specification] 
          
Specifies the tick-mark values for the horizontal axis.

Expands the horizontal axis to minimize the margins at the sides of the plot and 
to maximize the distance between tick marks, if possible.

[Syntax: HPOS=axis-length] 
          
Specifies the number of print positions on the horizontal axis.

[Syntax: HREF=value-specification] 
          
Draws lines on the plot perpendicular to the specified values on the horizontal axis.

[Syntax: HREFCHAR='character'] 
          
Specifies the character to use to draw the horizontal reference line.
Reverses the order of the values on the horizontal axis.

[Syntax: HSPACE=n] 
          
Specifies that a tick mark will occur on the horizontal axis at every nth print position, 
where n is the value of HSPACE=.
Assigns a value of zero to the first tick mark on the horizontal axis.

[Equivalent to LIST=0] 
          
Lists the horizontal and vertical axis values, the penalty, and the placement state 
of all points plotted with a penalty greater than or equal to 0.

Syntax: LIST<=penalty-value>
          
Lists the horizontal and vertical axis values, the penalty, and the placement state 
of all points plotted with a penalty greater than or equal to penalty-value.

Syntax: OUTWARD='character'
          
Tries to force the point labels outward, away from the origin of the plot, by 
protecting positions next to symbols that match character that are in the direction 
of the origin (0,0).
Overlays all plots that are specified in the PLOT statement on one set of axes.

Syntax: PENALTIES<(index-list)>=penalty-list
          
Changes the default penalties. The index-list provides the positions of the 
penalties in the list of penalties.

Syntax: PLACEMENT=(expression(s))
          
Controls the placement of labels by specifying possible locations of the labels 
relative to their coordinates.

Syntax: SLIST='character-list-1' <...'character-list-n'>
          
Specifies plotting symbols for multiple contour levels.

Syntax: SPLIT='split-character'
          
When labeling plot points, specifies where to split the label when the label spans 
two or more lines.

Lists all the placement states in effect. STATES prints the placement states in the 
order that you specify them in the PLACE= option.

[Syntax: VAXIS=axis-specification] 
          
Specifies tick mark values for the vertical axis.

Expands the vertical axis to minimize the margins above and below the plot and to 
maximize the space between vertical tick marks, if possible.

[Syntax: VPOS=axis-length] 
          
Specifies the number of print positions on the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VREF=value-specification] 
          
Draws lines on the plot perpendicular to the specified values on the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VREFCHAR='character'] 
          
Specifies the character to use to draw the vertical reference lines.
Reverses the order of the values on the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VSPACE=n] 
          
Specifies that a tick mark will occur on the vertical axis at every nth print position, 
where n is the value of VSPACE=.
Assigns a value of zero to the first tick mark on the vertical axis.
